programme.desc: An innocent domestic worker comes to realize her employer and benefactor, Dr. Jekyll, is hiding a horrifying secret involving his curious assistant.

programme.title: Wind
programme.desc: The open seas are ripe for adventure and romance as a man does his best to win the America’s Cup for the U.S. in a string of yacht races.

programme.title: Nothing in Common
programme.desc: A hilarious comedy about a perpetual adolescent who's forced to deal with his aging, unloving father when his mother leaves him flat.

programme.title: The Shadow Riders
programme.desc: Two brothers return home after the Civil War to find that their family has been kidnapped by a marauding band of rebel Confederate guerrillas.

programme.title: S.I.S.
programme.desc: An elite police squad hunts down the worst criminals in Los Angeles, but they may have met their match when they track a notorious, volatile killer.

programme.title: Home Invasion
programme.desc: A botched robbery turns into a hostage crisis as a gang of armed criminals holds a woman and four children captive while police surround the house.

programme.title: Stealth
programme.desc: Three of the world’s best pilots are partnered with a high-tech pilotless warplane, but soon it becomes clear that the machine has a mind of its own.

programme.title: Good Neighbor Sam
programme.desc: A happily married advertising agent helps out his single neighbor by posing as her husband so she can inherit a 15 million dollar fortune.

programme.title: Holiday
programme.desc: Johnny (Cary Grant) seems like a solid match for Julia (Doris Nolan), the socialite daughter of Edward Seton (Henry Kolker). Assured that Johnny is a worthy suitor, Edward approves of the pairing. But, as Johnny's wanderlust surfaces -- he is more interested in traveling than in business -- Edward starts to have doubts. Johnny also begins to wonder if he might not be a better match for Linda (Katharine Hepburn), Julia's outspoken younger sister, with whom he has much more in common.

programme.title: What a Woman!
programme.desc: An author (Willard Parker) and a literary agent (Rosalind Russell) become involved after selling film rights to his racy book.

programme.title: Hamlet
programme.desc: The prince's quest for revenge becomes his undoing when his suspicion is confirmed that his uncle killed his father to win the throne and his mother.

programme.title: Shopworn
programme.desc: After her release from a three-month prison sentence, Kitty Lane becomes an overnight musical sensation and renews her romance with David Livingston.

programme.title: Autumn Leaves
programme.desc: An aging, lonely spinster marries a good-looking younger man only to find that he has a very tormented past and is mentally disturbed.

programme.title: Picnic
programme.desc: Based on the play by William Inge.

programme.title: Miss Grant Takes Richmond
programme.desc: A bookie operating behind a real estate front gets pulled into the business for real when he hires a daffy secretary who thinks the office is legit.

programme.title: Duffy
programme.desc: A professional smuggler gets involved in a scheme by two half-brothers to steal a fortune from their wealthy father’s yacht in the Mediterranean.

programme.title: Harriet Craig
programme.desc: A cold, perfectionist wife will stop at nothing to have her house and life run as she wishes, even if it means controlling her husband's every move.

programme.title: To Sir, With Love
programme.desc: American Mark Thackeray (Sidney Poitier) recently received his degree in engineering, but cannot find work. To make ends meet, he takes a job as a teacher in a rough London East End school populated mostly with troublemakers who were rejected from other schools for their behavior. While the students at first see Thackeray as just another teacher open for ridicule and bullying, his calm demeanor and desire to see them succeed gradually earn him their respect.

programme.title: Anatomy of a Murder
programme.desc: Semi-retired Michigan lawyer Paul Biegler (James Stewart) takes the case of Army Lt. Manion (Ben Gazzara), who murdered a local innkeeper after his wife (Lee Remick) claimed that he raped her. Over the course of an extensive trial, Biegler parries with District Attorney Lodwick (Brooks West) and out-of-town prosecutor Claude Dancer (George C. Scott) to set his client free, but his case rests on the victim's mysterious business partner (Kathryn Grant), who's hiding a dark secret.

programme.title: Hot Blood
programme.desc: A gypsy woman who lives by decamping with marriage settlements from wealthy men meets her match in the handsome younger brother of a gypsy king.

programme.title: The Mating of Millie
programme.desc: A businesswoman (Evelyn Keyes) asks a bachelor (Glenn Ford) to help her find a husband so she can adopt an orphan.

programme.title: Born Yesterday
programme.desc: Brassy blonde moll Billie Dawn (Judy Holliday) hits Washington, D.C., with her unscrupulous millionaire sugar daddy, Harry Brock (Broderick Crawford), and his sleazy lawyer, Jim Devery (Howard St. John), who has been pressuring Harry to marry Billie by pointing out that a wife cannot be forced to testify against her husband. In an effort to make Billie more socially acceptable, Harry hires journalist Paul Verrall (William Holden) to smarten her up -- and sparks soon fly between the pair.

programme.title: The Whole Truth
programme.desc: Bored with his marriage, a movie producer has an affair with a temperamental actress. When she ends up murdered, all clues point to him as the killer.

programme.title: The Last Angry Man
programme.desc: A principled elderly doctor in Brooklyn remains suspicious when his would-be journalist nephew persuades him to let his life story be told on TV.

programme.title: Queen Bee
programme.desc: A naive, working-class Chicagoan enters a world of bitter jealousy and manipulative power plays when invited to Atlanta by her socialite elder cousin.

programme.title: The Wrecking Crew
programme.desc: Superspy, Matt Helm, with the help of agent Freya Carlson, travels to Denmark to find the mastermind behind the heist of a billion in US gold bullion.

programme.title: The Lone Wolf and His Lady
programme.desc: When a gem disappears from an exhibition, jewel-thief-turned-reporter Lone Wolf (Ron Randell) is accused.

programme.title: Bell, Book and Candle
programme.desc: A Greenwich Village witch falls for her dashing neighbor. When she learns he’s engaged, she casts a love spell but risks losing her powers for good.

programme.title: A Raisin in the Sun
programme.desc: Sidney Poitier stars in this iconic version of the famous play about a cash poor family who start to fray when they inherit a life insurance payout.

programme.title: Mr. Smith Goes to Washington
programme.desc: A youth leader and idealist fights false accusations and corruption from the political machine that engineered his appointment to the U.S. Senate.

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Four soldiers of fortune are hired by a wealthy rancher to rescue his beautiful young wife who has been kidnapped by a villainous Mexican bandit. When they finally find her, after fighting their way across deserts and mountains, they discover she is not being held against her will. This causes friction within the band as to whether they should honor their agreement.

programme.title: The Man From Colorado
programme.desc: In Colorado at the end of the Civil War, Col. Owen Devereaux (Glenn Ford), affected by four years of brutal bloodshed, orders the massacre of a Confederate unit, even as they try to surrender. Devereaux's friend and second in command, Capt. Del Stewart (William Holden), is the only one aware of the surrender attempt. Devereaux returns home to a hero's welcome and is appointed a judge, yet his irrational and angry behavior continues, affecting his fianceé, Caroline (Ellen Drew), as well as Del.

programme.title: Saddles and Sagebrush
programme.desc: A rancher (Russell Hayden) joins an outlaw gang to figure out how to stop it.

programme.title: Ridin' for Justice
programme.desc: A popular cowboy (Buck Jones) takes the blame for the death of a deputy who tried to force himself on the marshal's wife.

programme.title: The Rough, Tough West
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) looks for his friend Big Jack (Jack Mahoney) and finds out that Jack is illegally commandeering the mines and claims of others.

programme.title: The Man From Laramie
programme.desc: Will Lockhart (James Stewart) comes to the ranch town of Coronado looking for the man who is selling rifles to the Apaches, because his brother was killed with one. There he runs into Alec Waggoman (Donald Crisp), an aging rancher with a violent son named Dave (Alex Nicol). A conflict between Dave and Vic (Arthur Kennedy), Waggoman's top aid, helps Lockhart uncover the source of the rifles -- and also gets him involved in the power struggles at the Waggoman ranch.

programme.title: Lust for Gold
programme.desc: During the 1870s, the ruthless Jacob Walz (Glenn Ford) becomes very wealthy after locating a legendary Arizona gold mine and securing sole ownership by murdering his partner. Walz then travels to Phoenix, where he catches the attention of a beautiful and crafty woman named Julia Thomas (Ida Lupino), who has learned of his exploits. Eventually, Walz falls in love with Julia, unaware that she's already married to Pete (Gig Young), who is eyeing his fortune.

programme.title: The Shadow Riders
programme.desc: Two brothers return home after the Civil War to find that their family has been kidnapped by a marauding band of rebel Confederate guerrillas.

programme.title: The Longest Drive
programme.desc: After a decade apart, a pair of brothers reunites to find their long-lost sister, who was kidnapped as a child and is now living with a native tribe.

programme.title: Thomasine & Bushrod
programme.desc: In this beloved Blaxploitation flick set in 1911, a team of thieves steal from wealthy capitalists, to return their riches to deserving families.

programme.title: 7th Cavalry
programme.desc: Returning to Fort Lincoln, Capt. Benson learns of Custer's defeat at the Little Big Horn. At the inquiry as Custer's officers blame Custer for the defeat, Benson tries to defend him. However, Benson was suspiciously absent at the time of the battle and is now despised by the troops. So when an order to retrieve the bodies from the battlefield arrives, Benson volunteers for the dangerous mission of returning back into Indian territory.

programme.title: Banjo Hackett
programme.desc: Banjo Hackett, a free-spirited horse trader, accompanied by his orphaned nephew, travels the American West searching for a rare Arabian mare.

programme.title: Sierra Stranger
programme.desc: Jess Collins, a poor miner, helps Sonny chase off two men he calls claim jumpers. When he arrives in the nearby town, he learns Sonny is no good and everyone in town is against him.

programme.title: The Range Feud
programme.desc: When a murder occurs during a range war, a sheriff (Buck Jones) investigates to clear an innocent man (John Wayne).

programme.title: The Palomino
programme.desc: Steve Norris (Jerome Courtland), the heir to a meat-packing fortune, has a yearning to set out and forge a path of his own. His rebellious streak leads him to the broken down horse-breeding farm of the bewitching beauty Maria Guevara (Beverly Tyler). Enchanted by this determined young woman, Norris decides to assist her in saving her business. But this enrages duplicitous rival breeder Ben Lane (Roy Roberts), who steals away Guevara's prize palomino in an attempt to cripple her operation.

programme.title: Santa Fe
programme.desc: Three brothers become outlaws after the Civil War, while a fourth sibling goes to work for the railroad.

programme.title: The Last Rebel
programme.desc: Two Confederates (Joe Namath, Jack Elam) save a man's (Woody Strode) life and cause trouble in 1865 Missouri.

programme.title: Renegades
programme.desc: Hannah Brockway (Evelyn Keyes) has a perfect fiancé in Dr. Sam Martin (Willard Parker). Sam, who is respected by Hannah's family, is a noble man who cares for her and can make a good living in their frontier town. Yet Hannah craves adventure and finds it when she meets dashing Ben Dembrow (Larry Parks), the youngest of a notorious crime family. Together Ben and Hannah set off to forge a new life, but prejudice and strangling family ties soon bring trouble to these newlyweds.

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Four soldiers of fortune are hired by a wealthy rancher to rescue his beautiful young wife who has been kidnapped by a villainous Mexican bandit. When they finally find her, after fighting their way across deserts and mountains, they discover she is not being held against her will. This causes friction within the band as to whether they should honor their agreement.

programme.title: Jesse James vs. the Daltons
programme.desc: An outcast rumored to be the son of notorious outlaw Jesse James makes contact with the Dalton gang in hopes of learning the truth about his lineage.

programme.title: Laramie Mountains
programme.desc: The Durango Kid learns that crooked scouts are behind attempts to escalate a war between a local tribe and the cavalry.

programme.title: Buchanan Rides Alone
programme.desc: Journeying from Mexico back home to West Texas, mercenary Tom Buchanan (Randolph Scott) takes a break for the night in the border town of Agry. He soon discovers that almost every resident -- from the crooked sheriff (Barry Kelley) to the shifty-eyed innkeeper -- is a member of the prominent Agry family. When Buchanan defends Juan de la Vega (Manuel Rojas), a young man about to be lynched for shooting the town drunk, he himself is accused of murder and must struggle to escape town alive.

programme.title: Mackenna's Gold
programme.desc: Apaches, townsfolk, a Mexican bandit (Omar Sharif) and the cavalry follow a sheriff (Gregory Peck) to a mythical canyon of gold.

programme.title: The Kid From Broken Gun
programme.desc: After years on the East Coast, former boxer Jack Mahoney (Jack Mahoney) returns to New Mexico and finds himself framed for murder. Though the only evidence is circumstantial, in the face of vicious prosecutor Kiefer (Myron Healey), Mahoney's girlfriend -- defense lawyer Gail Kingston (Angela Stevens) -- fails to convince the jury of his innocence. Determined to clear Mahoney's name, postal worker Steve Reynolds (Charles Starrett) transforms himself into the masked rider known as the Durango Kid.

programme.title: North From the Lone Star
programme.desc: Wild Bill Hickok (Bill Elliott) puts on a badge to clean up a town.

programme.title: Jack McCall, Desperado
programme.desc: A lone gunslinger, Jack McCall (George Montgomery), bursts into a saloon and shoots dead the legendary Wild Bill Hickok (Douglas Kennedy). Arrested and put on trial, McCall recounts a twisted tale that paints Hickok as anything but heroic, explaining how Hickok and McCall's cousin Bat (James Seay) took over McCall's family's plantation, killed his parents and even framed him for crimes he didn't commit. McCall's cold-blooded killing of Hickok was warranted. Or was it?

programme.title: Ambush at Tomahawk Gap
programme.desc: Flaming arrows stop four ex-convicts searching a ghost town for their buried loot.

programme.title: Room Service
programme.desc: Deep in debt, a producer and his team fake a measles outbreak and a suicide in a wild bid to secure backing for their Broadway play.

programme.title: Task Force
programme.desc: A naval officer devotes his life to the development of an aircraft carrier.

programme.title: Tom Thumb
programme.desc: A six-inch-tall boy takes on a pair of comical crooks.

programme.title: Montana (1950)

programme.desc: A crack Nazi unit holds off the Allies during World War II.

programme.desc: Paleontologist David Huxley loses his fossil, his fiancée and his freedom.

programme.title: A Face In The Crowd

programme.title: The Office Wife

programme.desc: A bomber pilot goes to heaven and becomes guardian angel to another pilot.

programme.desc: Robert Louis Stevenson's tale of a boy out to find a buried treasure.

programme.desc: A family relocates from the city to the suburbs. Challenges ensue when a damaging play review leads a famed actress to target the husband.

programme.title: Onionhead
programme.desc: A lazy student enlists in the Navy expecting to sit out World War II.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team pursues a killer who targets women; Hotchner turns to an FBI cadet for help.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: After helping a man get parole, Morgan regrets his decision when the man murders someone shortly after being released.

programme.desc: A series of bizarre, ritualistic murders brings the team to Miami; Reid experiences hallucinations and blinding headaches.

programme.title: Criminal Minds

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team investigates unusual murders in Los Angeles, and more information about Prentiss' past arises.

programme.title: 18 Wheels of Justice
programme.desc: Chance and Cie go under cover to try to stop a truck hijacking ring.

programme.title: 18 Wheels of Justice
programme.desc: Jacob Calder (G. Gordon Liddy) supplies Chance (Lucky Vanous) with the name of a man who may know more about Chance's murdered wife.

programme.title: 18 Wheels of Justice
programme.desc: When Cie (Lisa Thornhill) finds her father, whom she has never known, she discovers he is planning a robbery. With Lucky Vanous. Guest star: Susan Hawk.

programme.title: 18 Wheels of Justice
programme.desc: Chance and Cie (Lucky Vanous, Lisa Thornhill) assume murdered criminal's identities to stop a bank robbery.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: A device that can prevent a nuclear meltdown is tracked through the Los Angeles sewers; Walter learns to listen and not offer advice to Paige; the team meets their new neighbor.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: Team Scorpion visits a renaissance festival, but the revelry is cut short when a group tries to rob a nearby police evidence locker; Paige grows weary of Walter pointing out the historical inaccuracies at the festival.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: Team Scorpion becomes stranded on a floating island of trash they were trying to destroy; Toby works with Cabe to uncover the details of his father's death.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: Team Scorpion tries to help a father and his daughter when their plane crashes nearby; Paige helps Walter navigate his feelings about Cabe's possible future in prison.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: The team anxiously awaits the verdict of Cabe's trial which could send him to prison; they use their nervous energy to try saving a dog stuck in a cistern.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: On Christmas Eve, Walter becomes unconscious after falling down the stairs and enters a dream world where Team Scorpion never existed.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: The team must work with Toby's nemesis and his wife -- Toby's ex-fiancée -- when they are locked inside an artificially intelligent doomsday bunker that aims to kill them; Walter is distracted by a dream in which he married Florence instead of Paige.

programme.title: Scorpion
programme.desc: Power is knocked out in Los Angeles, and the team must help a teen pilot and his girlfriend who are lost over the Pacific without any radio contact; Walter must look after a group of Ralph's classmates; Cabe tries to tell Allie that he loves her.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The team analyzes a BMX rider's remains, discovered on the roof of a warehouse; Sweets asks Booth for advice; Booth makes a decision about Hannah.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When the liquefied remains of a wedding planner are found in a tanning bed on Valentine's Day, Cam pressures the team to work fast so she can spend the holiday with her boyfriend; Clark helps Hodgins realize the best gifts come from the heart.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Sniper Jacob Broadsky takes out a victim who escaped from the justice system; Booth uses his military training to try to stop Broadsky before he strikes again; Angela's father visits the Jeffersonian.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: During a blizzard that causes a citywide blackout, the team must solve a murder case that could be connected to a possible viral outbreak; Sweets starts a touchy conversation about Brennan and Booth's relationship.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Brennan teams up with a forensic podiatrist to match seven pairs of severed feet with bodies; Cam makes college plans for her daughter.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A TV-show host's remains are found in the wilderness; Vincent Nigel-Murray makes surprising confessions while making amends with each member of the team.

programme.desc: When the remains of a maritime museum security guard are found in the Florida Everglades, Booth asks a former Iraqi soldier for help with the case.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: The remains of a successful ad man are found in a new community center playground; the members of the team try to communicate more honestly.

programme.desc: An unidentified 15-year-old girl, who is hearing impaired and not able to communicate, is found covered in blood and wielding a knife; Angela hides the details of her pregnancy.

programme.desc: Booth becomes more determined to catch Jacob Broadsky after he takes out another victim.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Booth and Brennan go under cover to find out what happened to a man whose remains were found lodged in the pinsetter at a bowling lane.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A woman's remains are found in a paintball field; Booth and Brennan adjust to life as an expectant couple.

programme.title: The Listener
programme.desc: After being drugged, Toby is implicated in an armed kidnapping.

programme.title: The Listener
programme.desc: Toby goes under cover when he believes an innocent man is taking the fall for a murder.

programme.title: The Listener
programme.desc: Becker's involvement in a criminal conspiracy sparks an investigation by Toby, Michelle and Dev.

programme.title: The Listener
programme.desc: Toby rescues a woman who has been in a car accident and uses his abilities to solve a kidnapping.

programme.desc: The investigation into the murder of a neighborhood do-gooder reveals he was planning on exposing something big.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio uncovers a scandal that pits him against a former adversary; Calleigh faces a life-altering decision.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: When an enemy of the CSIs is killed, Horatio looks to his team for a suspect.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team searches for evidence and survivors after a jet crashes into the Everglades, trying to recreate what transpired on the fatal flight.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio sets out on a personal mission to find his mentor's killer, and Megan worries that he has become too emotionally involved in the case.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio and Megan examine the remains of a human torso found in a tiger shark's stomach. Wanda De Jesus guest stars.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When a murder victim is discovered in San Diego and another is found in Los Angeles, the team thinks a murderous duo is responsible.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: When one Kansas family goes missing and another one turns up dead, the team looks for a link between the cases; Beth has surprising news for Hotch.

programme.desc: When four men from Oregon go missing, the team looks for a common link; J.J. is upset when her son doesn't want to celebrate Halloween.

programme.desc: The team searches for a killer in Miami who started out slaying animals and then quickly progressed to murdering prostitutes; Morgan asks Reid to join the bureau softball team.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The team travels to Santa Monica when burned bodies start showing up on a pier; Rossi gets together with his former Marine sergeant from Vietnam.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: An international cycling competition comes to the Midsomer village of Burwood Mantle. When the race leader is murdered, DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson find themselves drawn into a ruthlessly competitive world of blackmail, bribery and bloodshed where winning comes at any cost.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Art comes to the picturesque Midsomer village of Angel's Rise with the opening of a new Sculpture Park. But when its launch is marred by murder, DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson have to get creative to crack a case where art imitates death, and everything has a deeper meaning.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The discovery of a Saint's bones at an archaeological dig causes a stir in the village of Midsomer Cicely. But when the leader of the dig is murdered, DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson soon realise that it's not only skeletons that have been long buried in the hallowed ground.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The annual fair and the daredevil riders of the Wall of Death come to Midsomer village Whitcombe Mallet. When the owner of an equestrian centre is trampled by his horse DCI Barnaby and DS Nelson have to unravel a complex feud from the past, where nothing is what it seems...

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Peter and Caroline Cave are house-hunting in Midsomer Newton. Shortly before leaving their hotel they mention they haven't been able to find what they're looking for; "something old and derelict that they can do up." Anne Merrick tells them about Winyard, a tumbledown cottage in the woods, might be for sale. At the estate agents they are told the house is not yet available for viewing. Later that evening they find the house on their own. However, Caroline has read up on the cottage's haunted reputation and only reluctantly explores it with Peter. The next morning they are found strangled in their own car. DCI Barnaby starts the investigation with the help of PC Ben Jones and they come across the world of estate agents, identical twins, ghosts, piano wire, and more before another body turns up.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Villagers of Midsomer Barton are all set to celebrate Oak Apple Week, especially as the carnival queen event is set to return after an eight year absence. Yet the body of the mother of a deceased, one-time carnival queen, found in a stream, looks set to spoil things, as Barnaby and Jones find themselves digging up the past. From familiar faces, to drunken boasts and hidden obessions, it slowly becomes clear that the mother's daughter might be the key to solving the murder, when more deaths follow.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Wealthy, eccentric and obese aristocrat Freddy Butler drops dead, shortly after gathering all three of his wives at Haddington Hall to make an announcement. Although George Bullard is adamant his death is from natural causes, the case is far from simple when Freddy's solicitor is deliberately killed in a house fire shortly afterwards and Freddy's will goes missing. Barnaby and Jones find themselves investigating the extended Butler family, uncovering hidden secrets, illegitimate children and elusive treasure in the process.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Martin Barrett, a local council clerk living in Midsomer Worthy, is murdered during the night by shotgun, prompting Barnaby and Jones to find a motive for his murder. When they discover that Barrett was an expert blackmailer, his victims become prime suspects for his death - from a local pub landlord, a cleaner, a prominent member of the police board, to a former marine geologist. As they investigate, finding themselves drawn to the seaside, they slowly uncover deception, theft, attempted blackmail and hatred.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The unveiling of a newly-discovered novel by deceased Midsomer crime-writer George Summersbee at the Luxton Deeping Crime Festival is jeopardised when the manuscript is stolen and a woman is fatally electrocuted by a booby-trapped roulette wheel. Can new dad Barnaby untangle a web of jealousy and obsession to find the killer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Could a ballad made famous by late, lamented folk singer Johnny Carver be an inspiration for murder? Did someone want to kill Toby Winning for threatening to take the Little Crosby Folk Festival away from Midsomer - or is the true motive something hidden for 20 years?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a pub landlady is crushed to death during a magic show in Midsomer Oaks, Barnaby and Nelson uncover conflict between the village church and ancient pagan traditions. Is famous magician Gideon Latimer to blame or is he the target?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The fizz goes out of a sparkling wine launch when the glasses are laced with slug poison. Who is targeting the Midsomer Vinae Winery and what does the attack have to do with the death of a child in a hit-and-run accident?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: It's Christmas and new detective Charlie Nelson moves into Midsomer. He's thrown straight into an intriguing mystery in the village of Morton Shallows. A man is fatally stabbed with an antique sword during a ghost-hunting party at a "haunted" manor house. Can Barnaby and Nelson find a more earthly motive behind the murder and trap the killer?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A series of murders in Midsomer St Claire seem to be inspired by macabre images on a medieval fresco recently discovered in the church crypt. As the village prepares for storms and flooding it appears that someone is using ancient torture methods to punish modern-day "sinners". But who is responsible and why?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When wealthy farmer Martin Strickland is covered in truffle oil and mauled to death by a wild boar, the investigation leads to restaurant Wyvern House and its tyrannical celebrity chef Ruth Cameron. Secrets from the past surface and the killer strikes again - but the poison spreads wider than its intended target.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a body is discovered in a reservoir dropped out of a plane, Barnaby and Nelson find the world of stunt pilots and military heroes hides many dark secrets. Are campaigners against the local airfield behind Bernard King's murder or does it link back to a tragic story from World War Two?

programme.title: Super Sleuths - Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Midsomer Murders team opens up about their experience of working on the popular crime drama and provides insight into the overall process of bringing it to the small screen.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A disused airfield near Morton Fendle is the location for a romantic evening between young Simon Bright and his girlfriend Laura Sharp - absolutely nothing could ruin their date. The next morning, when Frances Kirby is out for her morning jog, she notices the vintage car they were in up at the airfield, containing Simon Bright's dead body, with Laura nowhere to be seen. Confused, Detective Chief Inspector Barnaby and D.S. Jones can't work out whether it was a suicide pact or murder. Furthermore, they've got to find Miss Sharp and their investigation leads them to linking Simon and Laura with the villagers of Morton Fendle, who met at Elaine Trim's dancing classes. Eventually, the Barnaby family plus Jones make it to a 40s style dance night at the village hall before more villagers start turning up dead.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Faith Alexander arrives in Midsomer County to meet her long-lost uncle Rex Masters, she gets a shock - Rex's staff had been told that she was dead. Things become even more complex when Rex's body is found in a nearby river, bearing wounds that suggest he was murdered. Barnaby and Jones are soon on the case, trying to establish who would have wanted the elderly man dead. Several people soon come forward with multiple wills, which confuse the matter, but when two more people, close friends of Rex, are also murdered, the investigation raises question on the motive, leading Barnaby to wonder if it was down to finances, passion, or something from Rex's past.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Following the death of Alan King while on a business trip to China, the family company, King's Crystal, is in financial trouble. As plans to shut the Midsomer Magna factory are being put into action, Alan's wife Hilary and brother Charles are married in the village church - much to the dismay of Alan's son Ian. In addition to strife between members of the family, the factory workers are outraged at the loss of their jobs. So when company accountant Peter Baxter is found murdered, Barnaby and Jones suspect a disgruntled employee is to blame. But in order to investigate the matter further, Jones is forced to work undercover, and infiltrate the local group of Freemasons in the village.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The music lovers of Midsomer County are delighted when a host of bands arrives for the Midsomer Rocks festival. Barnaby himself is particularly looking forward to seeing recently re-formed rock band, Hired Gun, perform on stage, but he soon gets close to the band for rather unfortunate reasons. During their opening performance, the band's singer, Mimi (Suzi Quatro), falls to the ground dead - electrocuted by a wire that had been run through the microphone stand. Barnaby and Jones soon find the rest of the band could be targets, and when another is killed, questions are raised as to whether former band member, Ginger Foxton, who went missing for 30 years and is presumed dead, is still at large. The detectives soon have to delve into a world of rock music, drug use and greed, to find the truth.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The suspicious death of popular young GP Dr Alan Delaney brings Barnaby and Jones to Midsomer Market to investigate. The detectives are baffled as to a motive for murder - until they consider that the newly engaged Dr James Kirkwood may have been the intended victim. Before long, Barnaby and Jones are heading to Wales - former home to Delyth Mostyn, James's fiancee, to delve deeper into the mystery. There are certainly possible suspects in the murder and attempt on Kirkwood, from Delyth's children, who oppose the engagement, Delyth's husband, and more, as the detectives investigate things, in hopes of uncovering the truth before a major walk is to take place on Mount Snowdon.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Pastry chef Chrissie Larkton's mill has been in her family for centuries. She restored it and turned it into a thriving online business, but the popularity has overshadowed Lower Blissingham, and many of the villagers are not happy about it.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A series of murders in Midsomer St Claire seem to be inspired by macabre images on a medieval fresco recently discovered in the church crypt. As the village prepares for storms and flooding it appears that someone is using ancient torture methods to punish modern-day "sinners". But who is responsible and why?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: In the build-up to Luxton Deeping's annual photographic exhibition, a battle rages between the traditional and digital photographers of the pretty village. The dispute seems harmless enough - until Lionel Bell is found murdered in a nearby woodland, strangled with the cord of his light meter. Barnaby soon gets to work tracking down the killer, but it seems someone is trying to implicate the detective in the murder. And once he is replaced on the case, finding the culprit seems less likely than ever, as his replacement is more concerned of an upcoming wedding than the investigation. Barnaby is forced to work off the case to uncover who is framing him, and who wants dead other photographers in the village.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The residents of Midsomer Magna are thrilled when a production crew arrives at the local manor house to film a version of The Scarlet Pimpernel. But the crew members aren't the only visitors to the area - Jones has spotted notorious criminal George Ince nearby. But when the director, Nick Cheney, is found dead - his head severed by a prop guillotine - Barnaby must discover who would have wanted the victim dead. It soon becomes clear that things are not so simple, and the detectives soon have to shift through varying motives, layered by lies, hidden truths, and a possible robbery to be committed.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby is in Midsomer Holm, bidding farewell to reformed criminal Ronnie Tyler, who has taken part in a rehabilitation scheme in the village. Also present is disgraced ex-policeman Jack Colby, a former colleague of Barnaby's – but Jack refuses to talk to his old friend. When Jack is murdered, the detective must delve into the dark secrets in the victim's past. There are certainly dark secrets to uncover, and Barnaby has to determine whether the victim's part in a scandal years earlier at Causton police station, is key to the mystery behind his death. It isn't long before he finds that Eddie Marston is attempting blackmail, and soon murdered as a result, and that Lord Holm is in love with Jack's wife, psychotherapist Gina.

programme.desc: The murder of a promising boxer draws Nikki and Jack into the world of underground boxing; meanwhile, Jack's brother Ryan is released from prison and comes to live with Jack and Conor.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Jack, Nikki and Simone investigate another death connected to the underground boxing ring; Jack's loyalty is tested when he fears Ryan has put Cara in danger.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Nikki's students make a discovery while dissecting a body donated for their training; the case that follows brings Nikki close to student Ollie, stirring dangerous feelings; meanwhile, Jack and Simone investigate the care home where the victim died.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Stranded in the flooded care home, Jack and Simone fight to keep the residents alive; meanwhile, Nikki and detective Galloway join the emergency relief effort and discover that Jack may be trapped with the killer.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: After the launch of Sam Ryan's new company in Liverpool, the health secretary is assassinated; Sam asks the Lyell team to investigate, but Nikki isn't sure she can trust Sam.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: DNA evidence linked to the Health Secretary's assassination forces Nikki to face her past; as her investigation progresses, Nikki realizes its consequences will affect her forever.

programme.desc: The best vehicles from all categories go under the hammer in a high stakes, no reserve auction in Scottsdale, Ariz.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A toy 1950s Ferrari Bimbo racecar is brought into the shop; Ron, Tyler and Brettly find a rare safe, a nickelodeon and a cigar dispensing slot machine.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick is contacted by Nellis Air Force Base to restore their replica of an F-105 fighter jet; Tyler's skills are challenged when a unique Buffalo Forge Grill is brought into the shop.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Steve works turning a rusted-out 1956 Willys truck into a BBQ kitchen-on-wheels; Bodie and his son transform a mini-Divco milk truck kiddie car from the 1960s into a souped-up go-kart.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A vintage scooter is shipped to the shop for a complete restoration; a dentist stops by with his 1920s x-ray machine.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Andy gets to work on an odd kit car that's part VW bug, part Delorean and part motorcycle; Dale builds a custom Harley for a customer looking to connect to his past.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Chris is tested on a Dale Drake scooter that arrives in pieces; a suit of armor is brought in for a restoration.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A hacked up 1970s Harley-Davidson golf cart is dropped off at the shop; a vintage 1950s toy horse pedal cart.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A 1970s wet bike is brought into the shop; Rick tests a loud-mouthed new painter in a high stakes shop competition against Horny Mike.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The pressure is on for Bodie when the largest restoration of his career flames out; Dale's routine tune-up on a 1946 Harley turns into a complete overhaul; the Monkey Business team runs into a hairy situation.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: A 1960s Pak Trak hunting scooter is brought to the shop; Rick calls Danny The Count to check out the unique dirt mobile; Kelly purchases a classic Mosrite guitar for Brettly's birthday.

programme.desc: It's full steam ahead when returning customer Mark Bassett brings in a late 1800's Velocipede.

programme.desc: Dave brings in his own engine to test run. The Ghouls fine tune Torino’s GTX and Mark and Alyssa meet a client with a special car.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: Will jams and preps the Green Go Challenger for its final paint while Allysa and Mark assess a newly arrived 1968 Dodge Charger; tired of Mark's antics in the paint booth, Will decides to take matters into his own hands.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: Will and Mark argue over color tints. Alyssa helps out in the shop and Goldberg’s GTX goes on a road trip.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: After nearly thirty years, Danny decides it's finally time to restore his late father's rare 1982 Mercedes Benz 500 SEC AMG, the way he would have wanted to.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Phil decides to teach his grandkids the value of a hard day's work by building a football field and culminating in a family football game. But Robertson vs. Robertson competition is further sparked.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After a big order comes in Willie pushes the Duck Commander team to meet the tight deadline, so Jase and the warehouse guys come up with a plan to build a conveyer belt.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Brotherly competition gets the best of Willie when he ditches his kids' career day to go play golf with Jase. Stepping in for Willie, Phil and Si show up at the school and become the teachers' worst nightmare.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After blowing up one of Phil's dangerously antiquated duck blinds, the Robertson boys hatch a wild plan to build a luxury duck blind in the sky. Meanwhile, Ms. Kay and the Robertson women hold a yard sale.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase feels being COO of Duck Commander entitles him to a new office. But when Willie refuses, Jase hatches a plan to build one anyhow. Willie takes Miss Kay and the grandkids to the petting zoo.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's duck blind maintenance time again and the boys have discovered the waterline is low. At the levee, they realize this is the work of Phil's bucktoothed arch nemesis...THE BEAVER.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's the 40-year anniversary of Duck Commander and this celebration is a redneck Robertson style shindig. To top off the event, Willie decides to construct the world's largest duck call to be revealed at the party.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: To prove once and for all who rules the river AND the boardroom, Willie and Jase revive their childhood rivalry and go head-to-head in a fishing competition with the added challenge of having to sell their catch.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: While out duck hunting, Willie, Jase, and Uncle Si stumble across what redneck's consider nature's most prized succulent treasure--a beehive dripping with wild honey.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When Willie finds out that his daughter Sadie has a new boyfriend, he wants to get to know him, while instilling some fatherly fear--Robertson style.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie decides to expand the Duck Commander brand into the winemaking industry and buys a vineyard...sight unseen.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase and Si embark on a turkey hunt for the annual Robertson men vs. Robertson women cook-off to create a feast of fresh wild game. With Phil's discerning palate as judge, the teams pull out all of the stops.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Jase volunteers to take the Duck Commander RV out on pick up, but neglects to mention to Willie, he's taking Si, Martin and Jep along for a road trip.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: It's all hands on deck for the Duckmen when an old high school nemesis challenges them to a good old fashion race... at the local lawn mower competition. But Willie and the guys soon find out that this sport is nothing short of high octane.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: With Sadie's (Willie's daughter) driver's license test fast approaching, she finds herself in dire need of lessons.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Willie's son (John Luke) leaves Willie's pickup in the driveway with a bone-dry gas tank, Willie and Korie decide that it's time to get the kid his own car.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Duck Commander assembly room gets an unexpected shakeup when a disgruntled Si decides to quit his job. But when Willie hires a replacement that clashes with the duck call room, Jase and the guys quickly become equally miserable at work. Meanwhile, Si turns to Phil for work out on the land turning a routine levee repair into a complete disaster.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie finds his office in shambles and alerts the authorities that the warehouse has had a break in. But soon Willie discovers that the culprit was his brother Jase, who needed supplies for an early morning frog hunt.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When a heat wave envelops West Monroe the air conditioning unit at the Duck Commander warehouse goes down, turning the duck call assembly room into a boiling sweatshop.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After Korie decides the junk piles in the Duck Commander warehouse are beginning to reach critical mass, she calls on Willie and the guys to do a little company spring-cleaning. But the discovery of an old Ping-Pong table deep within the clutter quickly turns the chore into an all day table tennis tournament. Meanwhile, Uncle Si realizes that he's many years overdue for an appointment with the local eye doctor and ventures out for some new glasses.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: After attending a local radio show as a guest, Willie sees an opportunity to host a show of his own. When the station gives him the opportunity, Willie makes the mistake of bringing Uncle Si on the air with him.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Jase, Si and the guys from the duck call room take a field trip to a brand new local donut shop and quickly find out who amongst them can eat the most delicious treats.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie receives a special gift from a Japanese business associate - a "priceless" samurai sword, which Willie keeps out of the hands of Jase and the guys.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: Willie pushes his work force too far after implementing new "motivational work tactics," and the guys rise up against him and go on strike.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: A compilation of the best scenes from all 11 seasons of A&E's hit series Duck Dynasty.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: When NASCAR sensation Clint Bowyer pays a visit to the Duck Commander warehouse, Willie and the guys are fired up to spend the day hanging out with the professional racecar driver. But too much enthusiasm about the celebrity's mode of transportation turns into a drag race showdown between Willie and Clint. Phil and Si have their hands full fixing Ms. Kay's barbecue when a trip to the outdoor grill store turns disastrous.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: A small convoy heads out on the winter roads with a giant oversized load. The treacherous journey over nearly impossible terrain will be the ultimate test of skill.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: The ice roads are at their meanest and slickest when Reno Ward has a disastrous encounter with a speeding pick-up.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Alex Debogorski is moving a construction shack that might be too heavy for the ice, so the veteran trucker uses a steel sled to drag the huge haul across a frozen lake.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: A volatile season is winding down and it seems like trouble comes in doubles. Lisa Kelly and Steph Custance barely get by when they team up for safe passage on the icy terrain.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: The spring thaw is in full melt mode as the drivers get one last lick before the ice roads close for the season.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Take a look at the men who undertake one of the most dangerous jobs on earth--ice road truckers.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: Jay hauls a 17-ton water tank over 31 inches of ice all the way to the De Beers Diamond mine.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: An arctic storm forces a road closure. Alex hauls a 44,000 pound diamond ore crusher across 350-miles of ice to the BHP mine.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's the 18th day of the ice road season and truckers have delivered more than 3000 loads to the diamond mines. The temperatures are dropping, the loads are getting heavier.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: It's half way through the grueling ice road season. Six hundred truckers have ferried more than 4,000 loads to the northern mines.

programme.desc: Spring brings a rush of warm weather and the big melt begins. The road is nearly empty as only the toughest or craziest truckers remain.

programme.desc: It is a job only a few would dare. This year, four ice road truckers, Hugh, Alex, Rick and Drew, return from last season to join Arctic veterans.

programme.desc: After just two days in the Arctic, the critical demands of the oil exploration sites are testing the limits of the truckers and their machines.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: There's no rest for the righteous and nobody knows this better then the Dog. He is committed to saving his new friend's bail bonding business, and now must race against time to bring a rogues gallery to justice.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Can Dog complete his mission to clean-up this frontier town? With four outlaws still on the lam, Dog sets out to bring 'em in. As day turns into night and with the darkness and the danger mounting, an undaunted Dog and team plan late night hits.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and company head to the Big Island in pursuit of two courthouse no-shows only to find that one of them appears to be posting status updates from Southern California.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: This hunt is personal. Dog's good friend and fellow bondsman Chris is running out of time. He has only days to find his fugitive or risk losing his business. In his hunt Dog confronts duplicitous tipsters, vicious attack dogs, and hostile neighbors.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The bounty-hunter adventures of Duane "Dog" Chapman and his Posse are chronicled in this one hour "Best Of" special, featuring superlative memorable moments from the previous seven seasons.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A small town bondsmen is in over his head, his business on the line, when he makes a desperate plea for help. Dog agrees and launches a high stake hunt through the desolate and dangerous mountain landscape of western Colorado.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Once in Montrose, Dog discovers that the million dollar fugitive is not the young bondsman's only problem. His kind heart and inexperience have led him to bail out a bevy of bail jumpers.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: There's no rest for the righteous and nobody knows this better then the Dog. He is committed to saving his new friend's bail bonding business, and now must race against time to bring a rogues gallery to justice.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Can Dog complete his mission to clean-up this frontier town? With four outlaws still on the lam, Dog sets out to bring 'em in. As day turns into night and with the darkness and the danger mounting, an undaunted Dog and team plan late night hits.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and company head to the Big Island in pursuit of two courthouse no-shows only to find that one of them appears to be posting status updates from Southern California.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog decides to sweep the island clean of as many fugitives as he can in two days. Raymond, wanted on drug charges, is an easy grab. Mauro, wanted for solicitation, is busted.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog has only a few days to catch a woman nicknamed Cats or forfeit Beth's $10,000 bond. But it won't be easy - Cats is eight months pregnant, so Dog will have to lure her in rather than risk a violent grab.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and Beth are finally getting married! They've been together for more than ten years but Dog is determined, as he puts it, to "marry his common law wife the Christian way." There are big nuptials planned on the Big Island.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is back hunting in the big city of Denver, but chasing fugitives on the mainland is more dangerous than ever. So Dog decides that the crew should get pepper-ball guns, which have much better range than pepper spray.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog finds himself fighting two enemies--the law and his inner demons. He continues his legal battle to fight extradition to Mexico in connection with his 2003 capture of fugitive rapist Andrew Luster. His other struggle is private.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog usually takes his job personally, but this time a case really hits home. First, he and Beth receive a special gift--a painting of Dog's recently deceased daughter, Barbara Katy.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Kimo does a vanishing act for his day in court and now Dog and the posse have to find him. With precious few leads to follow Dog turns to the fugitive's on again-off-again girlfriend, but she's initially reluctant to join the hunt.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: A one-hour special that looks back at 2006, one of Dog's most tumultuous years, which has included the passing of Beth's father, Dog and Beth's wedding, the tragic death of Dog's daughter Barbara, and the sudden arrest of Dog, Tim, and Leland.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today Dog and the family are back in Colorado and are about to make one of their most exciting captures ever. On his search he'll encounter a felon with history of violence and an alleged affection for sawed-off shotguns.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens

programme.title: Ancient Aliens

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: One of history's most notorious pirates, Blackbeard, is said to have had a treasure worth millions of dollars; after centuries of searching, the legendary hoard remains missing.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: It's a treasure coveted by everyone from Roman emperors to Adolf Hitler; a sacred object said to hold incredible powers of healing, resurrection and immortality, the Holy Grail is the most sought-after relic in the world.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: It's one of the most famous stories from the Bible; for thousands of years the tale of Noah's Ark is shared, but little is known about what happened to the ark.

programme.desc: In a perfectly planned robbery, thieves steal half a billion dollars in masterpieces from the Gardner Museum in Boston; it's been three decades since the brazen heist, and an exhaustive search has failed to recover the stolen goods.
